website_summaries.verdict: The Adventure Medical Sportsman Bighorn kit is designed as a comprehensive first aid kit for remote use. This is not an ideal kit for office or home use, although some users may want to take it to sporting events or casual camping trips.
pros: Includes more advanced medical tools for real trauma treatments in remote areas
Carrying case tightly packed with enough supplies for long camping trips
Extended shelf life for sterile or perishable items
cons: Initial supplies are useful, but we recommend adding additional items for specific kinds of common injuries
Storage bag is smaller than it appears in photo
Needs more burn-related ointments and pain medications

customer_reviews.title: Decent first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Overall I purchased for a 3 day backcountry hike/camp for 5 people. I knew the Band-Aid supply was low so that is not a big deal as I can buy pretty cheap. The medicine in the kit is dated Feb 2010. I purchased in April 2019 so be prepared for the medicine to be dated under a year. The kit does not have everything that is listed on Amazon - like 2 syringes. It comes with one - not sure why they would have put 2 in here anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out; excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and well thought out kit. I can find no fault with this more advanced first aid kit. This kit gives you the ability to address injuries that exceed small cuts and scratches. Supplement with CELOX packets and Lidocaine burn gel/pads and you have a truly capable kit. I did that and also added a dental first aid kit (same brand) and consider my kit far above your typical kit.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Schultz

customer_reviews.title: good pressure dressing
customer_reviews.text: A little bulky and needs additional items here and there (acedaminaphen, good pressure dressing, good tourniquet, etc) but not bad all and all. If you are pretty first aid inclined, your going to want to cross load some stuff though.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Spanish

customer_reviews.title: Great med kit
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a med kit for my Bug Out Bag that would not take up a lot space in the bag, and also provide a good range of first aid materials for a variety of first aid needs, including serious open wounds. This first aid kit does just that. I did add an Israeli bandage, but this first aid kit has bandages and gauze pads that will cover injuries, and includes Quikclot ...
customer_reviews.author: Radio Relay

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit
customer_reviews.text: This has way more useful items than most kits. I bought it for an emergency kit for my home. Yes I can always go to a hospital, but keeping someone from bleeding out or regulating pain and open wounds before or while traveling to the hospital may make all the difference. Lean on the old saying "I would rather have it and not need it, than need it and not have it."
customer_reviews.author: Just a person

customer_reviews.title: Good for your emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: As a surgical physician assistant I can tell you that this is a pretty comprehensive kit for the money. I will be adding some sutures and small instruments to complete it.
customer_reviews.author: Scout538

customer_reviews.title: Compact kit
customer_reviews.text: Im not a medic....so I cant give you some in depth review on this. What I can give you is that this kit has the basic items to help with a trauma. I bought this kit in preparation for a remote camping trip. I was looking for something that was relatively light weight and had the required items to stop bleeding. yes it has some basic stuff but over all its a good compact kit with some quickclot. Don't forget to hit the helpful button.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Comprehensive Content
customer_reviews.text: A great kit...worth it to upgrade to the Bighorn kit to get the Quick Clot. I like the organization and the separate "trauma" area. I wish the meds were in greater abundance...rather silly to claim that 4 or so Ibuprofen tablets is sufficient for a party of up to 7 people on a week-long trek into the deep woods. For any medical professionals or those with great experience, I'd recommend that you build your own kit. For a non-pro like myself, or for someone looking to keep their precious time for family activities, I recommend the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PensFifthCup

customer_reviews.title: First aid kit, better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice kit, a little pricey but appears to be very complete.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always good to have a kit when camping
customer_reviews.text: Always good to have a kit when camping!! Of course it helps to add your own needs and what you think is missing the kit but overall amazing quality and comes with a first aid book for those who need a little guidance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life's adventures can give a bruising!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of necessary items in this kit, for the times that Life's adventures need some patch & repair work. I'm an RN; this kit impressed me! Well done!
customer_reviews.author: J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Just in case you bust your face
customer_reviews.text: My emergency med kit. I keep in my truck because I stop at an unusual amount of car crashes...seriously.. it's uncanny. It's got the essentials. I also added a SAM splint and sniffing salts . I'm an EMT. This bag is smaller than you'd think. Approx. 6" wide. 4" tall 3-4" thick. But it gets er done
customer_reviews.author: joshua treasure

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I haven’t needed this kit, yet. I did check through it with my wife. She’s an ER nurse and she thinks the materials are decent quality which is hard to find in a lot of first aid kits.
customer_reviews.author: RollaAF

customer_reviews.title: This came sealed (i. e. with a tie ...
customer_reviews.text: This came sealed (i.e. with a tie still around the zippers) but missing all the medicines. Not worth the hassle of returning/exchanging when that's all that's missing, but a pain to have to spend extra time/money completing what should have been a complete kit. (Also, no response at all from Adventure Medical Kits when I used the "contact us" form on their site.)
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: All the stuff I hope I never need...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4/25/16, expiration date 05/2017. Bought this plus a SAM splint, burn kit, and Israeli bandages. Great kit, great field medicine guide.
customer_reviews.author: Crowbait

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat pricey kit. Divides into 2 sections when opened, one for routine burns and cuts, the other for extreme wounds. Kind of pricey but seems complete. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Am. Cust.

customer_reviews.title: Bad!! Items expire this year 2019!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was severely dissapointed with the money spent compared to what I received. Most of the items (medication and supplies) expire in 2019 or 2020. Seems like they are packaging items to use them up.
customer_reviews.author: Dking

customer_reviews.title: Was mailed kit with less than one year before it expires!
customer_reviews.text: Missing items from various sections and less than one year before most items expire. Opened kit to inspect inside too late to return. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: FD

customer_reviews.title: Ready to use.
customer_reviews.text: This kit is labeled and ready for use. We needed it almost immediately and were so glad to have it near by.
customer_reviews.author: BMariFalla

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This kit pretty much has everything. I put in a few other things such as a big tube of antibiotic cream and more meds and took out a few things that were a bit bulky. A great starter pack. It pretty much has everything. It also has a great book about outdoor medicine.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey U.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for car or outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.text: There are great for your car or get home bag. Right balance of contents and size/compactness. Well designed and organized. Hope I don't need it but if I do, I'm sure what I will need is in there. Not an EMT or Medical professional.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: better face shield
customer_reviews.text: Added a few things on (more gloves, better face shield, anti-diarrhea meds) but overall this is a pretty good kit
customer_reviews.author: Logan Qualls

customer_reviews.title: Well made and hopefully I'll never need to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and hopefully I'll never need to use it. I also have a supplemental tourniquet to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Good contents, could have used a few more bandages, but overall not bad. -1 star because the handle ripped out after just moving it around.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a friend. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaMovieStar

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It could be a bit more durable, overall worth the money. Love the miniature roll of duck tape.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Excellent med kit with all the accessories you need
customer_reviews.text: Excellent med kit with all the accessories you need. I use mine for backpacking. Add and remove whatever you want. The kit and sleeves are perfect for organization.
customer_reviews.author: Hochimin

customer_reviews.title: Everything I would need
customer_reviews.text: prefect for the outdoors hunting and fishing. I leave it in my truck. Ample supplies for a few people if an emergency occurs
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one
customer_reviews.text: From what I can tell this is a great kit money. My only suggestion would be that I wish came in waterproof bag. Happy with purchase though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit for all outdoor adventurers. We are not hunters, but avid outdoors people. This kit has everything we need and could possibly need - just in case.
customer_reviews.author: BearSmith

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the small side, but good kit
customer_reviews.text: Overall good kit, but it's a bit smaller than I had imagined. It seems pretty complete and I'm happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Good price for what it is!!
customer_reviews.text: I found this same kit as bass pro shops for $75 dollars so I am very happy with this purchase for the price!!! Good deal👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best first aid kits you can get.
customer_reviews.text: Fully loaded for 90% of any mishaps/injuries. And 100% recommended for anything from picnics to natural disasters.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Great first aid kit. Well equipped. The case could be a little bigger. The first aid book gives a lot of information.
customer_reviews.author: Gcassn

customer_reviews.title: This kit is by far my favorite for the compromise in size
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several first aid kits over the year, and several different ones from Adventure Medical. This kit is by far my favorite for the compromise in size, and completeness
customer_reviews.author: seattleBryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have two medical kits from these guys. They put out a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hope I never have to break it out. it has alot for a small bag.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck D.

customer_reviews.title: pretty good kit
customer_reviews.text: Good kit, like others have said, the bag is a little small. Would be nice to have a bigger bag to add other items. All in all a nice kit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Potter

customer_reviews.title: Good kit, I added a few things to it ...
customer_reviews.text: Good kit, I added a few things to it to make it meet my needs. Perfect size and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kit!!
customer_reviews.text: I felt i had to leave a couple negative reviews recently so im thrilled to get this amazing kit and leave some genuinely positive feedback!! It was packaged great by amazon and the kit itself seems nice and sturdy. The contents inside are very extensive, and the trauma pack and book really make this kit stand out from others of different brands. I added a small flashlight and DONE!! I feel that although it isnt cheap, its totally worth the cost. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to make sure I was covered on my BOB.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ball

customer_reviews.title: wish the bag allowed more room for additional items
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and they seem to be very comprehensive. I went through all the items and was pleased with what I found. I planned on adding additional items such as larger blood clotters,some generic bottles with more tylenol and aspirin etc but the room wasn`t there. I guess I will have to pack a 3rd bag with the misc I want. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great kit for Scout troop heading out to Swampbase this summer.
customer_reviews.author: ladydtx

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit, kind of bulky, takes up a lot of space in my Osprey 70 liter backpack. But I wouldn't go backpacking without it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Amazing medical kit
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY everything I was looking for in a range bag medical kit. Perfect size and great contents. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gren

customer_reviews.title: Be Prepared!
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully I never have the opportunity to use the kit. However, if I do, it looks like it has all the required items.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the outdoors or vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone going out into the woods or the range. I would highly recommend getting a "quik clot" sponge product and tuck it into this kit as well, which is what I did. Everythign you need in an easy to use package. Only feedback I have for all the adventure medical kits is there is not a lot of room in the packs to add extras such as a larger vial/bottle of frequently needed items instead of single serve packages such as bandage strips and ibuproferen.
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth 50 bucks
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can make your own better version. This is a one time use kit. Not good for a home kit at all, or much good either really, because of all the one use stuff. A one use thermometer? For 50 bucks, where's an actual thermometer??
customer_reviews.author: B.C. Legans

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of quantity but a lot of the types of things you would need in an emergency or a bad wound. Too many of these kits don't provide with the necessary bandages or other things. This one does and it's not a toy. I put it in my survival earthquake kit.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: One of the best first aid kits
customer_reviews.text: Great first aid kit. It is large but it has so much. We just added an instant cold pack, childrens ibuprofen tabs, and a tube if Neosporin. A must for camping with the family and off the beaten path hikes. You never know what you will need but you should be covered with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Medical kit
customer_reviews.text: Did not have to use it yet. It has everything you would need to patch up any type of wound, even Gun shots. Better prepared than sorry
customer_reviews.author: Alan Matsunaga

customer_reviews.title: Trauma kit offers good peace of mind when I am out hunting
customer_reviews.text: Small, lightweight, complete. Contained everything my wife & I needed for many trips to the woods. Trauma kit offers good peace of mind when I am out hunting. Haven't needed it (thankfully), but better to have it and not need it. Added some extra burn gel, tape, and a few odds and ends to treat minor wounds the dog might pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought the kit would have been bigger.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the kit would have been bigger. I did not think it was worth what I paid for it
customer_reviews.author: ronv11

customer_reviews.title: super
customer_reviews.text: great product d d d a a a aa a a a a aa a aa a a best 1
customer_reviews.author: james jurado

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the hunter in your life
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my husband for Christmas. He hunts and I'm always worried about him getting injured while camping or in a treestand. This has all the necessities for when in the woods alone or with a group. I feel better about his hunting trips already.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kay

product_meta.title: Adventure Medical Kits Sportsman Series Bighorn First Aid Kit
product_meta.description: With a lightweight, portable design and top-quality components, the Adventure Medical Kits' Easy Care Sportsman Series Bighorn Medical Kit is essential for emergency preparedness in a variety of travel situations. Designed for adventurous hunters and fishermen, this outdoor first aid kit contains medical supplies to treat the most common injuries in the field. Provide hospital-quality first aid for groups of up to seven people on trips up to a week with this first aid kit suited for boat, basecamp, or backpack duty. Housed in a bright orange case with a removable waterproof Field Trauma Kit for trips away from camp. Use the emergency kit to treat penetration wounds from bullets or arrows, remove fish hooks, splint fractures, and stop severe bleeding with QuikClot self-adhering elastic bandage and trauma pads, all from secure see-through compartments to quickly gather the supplies you need. Consult the included illustrated, comprehensive guide on wilderness and travel medicine and confidently administer first aid with the appropriate dressings, tools, and medications. This medical kit includes sterile bandage materials, wound care, blister/burn care, CPR face shield, fracture/sprain care, common medications, and essential tools, all contained in a high-visibility trauma kit.
feature_bullets: Accommodates groups of up to 7 people on trips up to 1 week
Easy Care Organization System with injury-specific pockets so you can find what you need quickly
Top quality first aid essentials and tools that set the standard in backcountry medicine
First aid instructions have the most up-to-date information from the world authorities in first aid
Contains vital trauma supplies to stop bleeding, close wounds, and stabilize fractures and sprains
